title: The Alliance Leader's Ambitions
opening: Though plans to resist the Empire are still being devised by the Alliance army, the Imperial army has already anticipated their next move. An Imperial vanguard, just outside Garreg Mach, led by General Randolph, begins to advance with the aim of toppling the monastery once again.
Fulfilling a promise made five years ago, your former students gather once more at the monastery, as do the knights. However, your joyful reunion is cut short...

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Good work, Hilda! You didn't do much manual labor, but you managed to rope the knights into helping us restore the monastery.

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Thanks, Claude, but all I did was piggyback on your scheme. I saw your eyes telling me to make some magic happen!

dialogue.speaker: Alois
dialogue.line: Thank you so much for your help with the restoration.

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Oh please, it was nothing! We're just doing our part as former students.

dialogue.speaker: Catherine
dialogue.line: I'm told you even routed the bandits. That job should have fallen to us. I'm sorry for the trouble.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Hey, don't think twice about it. We're all allies in the resistance against the Empire, right?

dialogue.speaker: Catherine
dialogue.line: The church is at war with the Empire, but let's be realistic. Wouldn't it be better for the Alliance to eventually submit?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The way I see it, the emperor wants to take over all of Fódlan and destroy the existing order of the world. I can't see her allowing the Alliance to continue to exist. We're in this just as deeply as you are. Actually… We were hoping to use this place as a base. The Empire begs to be meddled with, and we're first in line.

dialogue.speaker: Alois
dialogue.line: What? Why would you want to make your base here of all places?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Garreg Mach is situated in the center of Fódlan, both geographically and spiritually. We want to secure this location while the Empire is still overlooking it.

dialogue.speaker: Catherine
dialogue.line: I see. The Empire doesn't see this place as important at the moment because it's far from the front lines.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: But if we simply decide that it's ours to occupy, that does nothing to inspire the hearts and minds of the people of Fódlan. Luckily, good ol' Teach has finally returned to us. If the Professor Rhea entrusted with the Sword of the Creator fights at our side… Well now. That's a just cause anyone could get behind. What's more, here we are, working alongside the legendary Knights of Seiros. It smacks of divine providence, doesn't it? Can you feel it?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I have heard what you have to say, Claude. And you, Professor? Where do you stand?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Hm. On our own, we lack sufficient military strength. But with the help of the Alliance…

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Hm. We are at a relative standstill, but with the help of the Alliance…

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: The archbishop said if anything should happen to her, that we should entrust the affairs of the church to you. If you intend to fight alongside the Alliance, then I will follow you as well. Is that acceptable, Claude?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Of course. I can't think of anything more reassuring than having both Teach and the knights on our side. Together, we'll stop the emperor and her reckless ambitions!

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Hey there, my friend. It's funny how the monastery was once in ruins, but now it's downright bustling. Thanks to a little promise five years ago, our buddies have all gathered, and even the knights have returned. It's like we were all just waiting for you to awaken. And now we're all going to band together against the Imperial army. You should go and talk to everyone, if you can. There may be some who are still on the fence.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: I have written to my father to signal my intention to remain here. Not that I require his approval to do so. There is not much for me to gain by returning to Alliance territory now. But by staying, I will be able to influence the course of events directly, on the field of battle.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Will you get along with the Alliance leader?

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: We will not be friends, but I will cooperate with him as much as is necessary to secure victory.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Will you keep an eye on the Alliance leader?

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Naturally. Someone needs to make certain he does not lead the Alliance to ruin.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Fighting alongside you and everyone else is a dream come true, Professor! And don't worry about my little sis. Right now she's back home helping out with the family business. I kinda figured I was gonna be stuck going back and taking over for her. But thanks to you and Claude, I get to work on my dream of becoming a proper knight!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: It's been fixed up quite a bit, but it's battle scars aren't so easily erased... To think that a glorious cathedral, with a thousand year history... would end up like this. I'll rebuild this place someday. This cathedral is the symbol of Fódlan. Maybe I should paint a picture of the beautiful cathedral of old, while I still remember what it looked like...

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I've grown weary and impatient - these past five years, my hands have been bound. But now, I can finally take action with a clear goal. I'm grateful to you and to everyone.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I didn't do anything.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Nonsense. Your presence steeled everyone's resolve.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: And that goal is?

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Down with the Empire! Surely peace will soon follow if the Empire is overthrown. Then my parents can finally find peace themselves.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Even with the church in shambles, we can still pray. The goddess will surely hear our prayers, but still... I hope the church can return to it's former beauty someday.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: I'm pretty headstrong, but Claude could give me a run for my money. I mean, he's dragged the knights into this. You ought to be careful, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'll be fine.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: I wonder if you've got a hidden headstrong side? You must be hiding it really well though.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You too.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Don't worry about me. I'm here because I want to be. Also because being around my big brother feels like a real chore.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: It's not just for my village that I'm fighting alongside you here, you know. It's also that Captain Jeralt asked me, his first and greatest apprentice, to look out for you. Of course, it wouldn't be enough just to keep you alive. It's my duty to make sure you win too. So do your best, Professor. And count on me to watch your back.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: I have lost my dominion. My nobility may seem like nothing more than a title. But I will never lose my noble heart. I will stop Edelgard, even if it costs me my life. I have turned my blade against her now. I cannot go back on that decision. Professor… Do you think I chose the wrong path?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Not at all.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll find out soon enough.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: You are right…

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: The promise was made five years ago, but I must say I'm rather surprised how many of us managed to make it. Personally, I only showed up because I hoped to see you again, Professor. I've been with my family in the Empire until recently. I admit to feeling a little guilty betraying Her Majesty...but only a little. Now that we're all together again, I suppose the fighting will begin soon.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Hey, Professor! You won't believe what happened! I figured I couldn't go back to the Empire after Garreg Mach fell, so I started drifting across the Kingdom and Alliance. Then, I just happened to run into our old class, so we came back to the monastery together!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Ah, at last, I return to my domain! My lonely paradise! My realm of exquisite Solitude! Huh? Professor? Is that, um. Is that you? You, um. You didn't hear that just now, did you?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Sorry.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Oh! Forget you heard anything!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Hear What?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Right. You didn't? Well, um. Good.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Laaa-la-laaa-la-laaa... Professor! Oh my! It's so good to see you. These days, so many old friends seem to be disappearing. But you... You're here! It's incredible to see you again after five years! I have a feeling your name will go down in history.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Edelgard is controlling the Empire. She is putting the pressure on the Kingdom and Alliance. Empire and religion are at open war. It will be… difficult for us at first. But corrupt nobles are many. That means the common people will rebel and be joining our side. With you, Professor, the battle tides will…ah, will turn. I have certainty.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: A country with no king has no future. That's why I made my way here. Professor, don't let me down.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Country with no king?

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Hmph. You'll understand soon enough.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's forge ahead.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Yes, let's. Find me a worthy opponent to battle and I'll be content.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I'm the heir of House Gautier, and I'm fighting alongside a bunch of Alliance people? I can just imagine my father's face contorted in anger and the delightful words he must have used to describe me. I don't know how standing and fighting for Faerghus would have helped. Sorry, Professor. I don't regret my decisions. I'm just thinking out loud. And I'm hoping I haven't made a big mistake.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: You're here, Professor, along with everyone from our old class. It's like we've gone back in time! When I think that I'll be around you again, all of my sorrows just drift away.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Frankly, I don't feel too happy.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Hmm, I understand. Especially with Lady Rhea missing...It sounds like the Kingdom and Empire have been in a sorry state too. But we can't let that get us down!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's do our best together.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Hmm, yes. I'll at least try not to hold anyone back.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Let's work together for the common good, like we did five years ago!

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Members of the knights tell me that Father left their ranks five years ago. They say he announced he was returning to the Kingdom, but nobody’s heard from him since. I haven’t received word that he went back to Mother… Where could he be… Where are you, Father…

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Professor. I have a proposal. Why not go beyond the Knights of Seiros—instead, uniting with allies from all across Fódlan to fight for our cause? Looking back, it would have been best to ally with the Kingdom and join forces against the Empire. But now the Kingdom is not exactly… Well…

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Five long years, I've searched for you and the archbishop. It's a pleasure to see you again. The Church of Seiros will follow you from now on, but please do not abandon the search for Lady Rhea.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll do whatever it takes to find her.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Thank you. I know the battles ahead will be dire, but we will support you with all our strength.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We don't know what the future will bring.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Wherever she is, Rhea is doubtlessly waiting for you. Please do not let her down.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Professor, I am so glad you are unharmed! No matter the path you walk, I will be with you every step of the way. Anything you ask of me, I shall see it through. You saved my life, and I am in your debt.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Thankfully, it appears the records and equipment I need for my research have not been damaged. I am most curious though. You say you were asleep for five whole years? Incredible. Perhaps this is another effect of your Crest. I do look forward to investigating you in greater detail.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can talk about that.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Wonderful news! I am most excited to begin. We must find the time, of course.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Uh, maybe later...

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: I'll have to be content with observing you wherever you go, then. I cannot waste any opportunity!

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: My, Professor. You haven't changed a bit! At your age, I'd expect your whole demeanor to have changed greatly over five years... Though I suppose I haven't changed either, right? Thank you for noticing, by the way. Ah, Just the two of us, forever young. Oh, let me have my fun.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I'd given up on ever seeing you again. Where have you been hiding? Anyway, now that we're reunited in the land of the living, I must fulfill my promise!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What promise?

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: The promise I made to the captain! to keep you safe! I can't believe you've forgotten. How cold...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Right, the Promise.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: That's right! I promised the captain I'd protect you in his stead, and now I'll make good on my word!

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: In Lady Rhea's absence, I will follow you. That's what she would want me to do. Know that wherever you might lead us, I'll continue searching for Lady Rhea.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's fine.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Good, because I will not budge on that point. Welcome back, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Sounds like a lot of trouble.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: I don't care how much trouble it is! I will rescue Lady Rhea, at all costs.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: I'm more of a mercenary than a knight these days. I work to get paid. I never was too attached to Fódlan. I was considering leaving soon... But I might change my mind if you're around.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: I don't know anything about rebuilding, but I can sure do my best to clean up the mess. I'm gonna keep Lady Rhea's room spotless, so she can use it right away whenever she gets back. You gotta find her, Professor. You just gotta.

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! You know, it's such a thrill to be able to greet you like this again! I almost died as well in the battle five years ago, but I won't allow any enemies to get into this place again, I promise you that! Even if the Death Knight shows up, I'll be sure to... Well, for now I'll keep training so I can eventually feel confident that I can stop him!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Everyone, listen up! I have a proposal. We are now building our forces in order to rise up against the Imperial army. But it wouldn't be smart for us to fight under the banner of the Alliance. That would only incite the lords who support the Empire. We've also combined forces with the Knights of Seiros. Therefore, I suggest that we operate under a new symbol. That's why I've prepared this...

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: You may recognize it as the Crest of Flames, which resides in Teach. The phantom Crest that has reappeared after more than 1,000 years. We're attempting our own miracle, so it seems like a suitable symbol for us. So... Until we welcome the dawn of a new age in Fódlan... Let's fight to the very end, as one, under the symbol of the Crest of Flames!

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Impressive, Claude. Forget restoring the monastery. You've somehow roped everyone into fighting back against the Empire!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: If you recall, I never asked anyone to join us. If anything, we have Teach's achievements to thank. Now that you mention it, I guess I should express my gratitude.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Hey, friend. So this is where you've been. Without you, the knights never would have joined our cause. I could never pay you back for that.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: You're welcome.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's do our best.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Just leave it to me, Teach. When this fight is over, I plan to see all of my dreams come to fruition, and yours as well.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What are you dreams, Claude?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Well, for example... to bust open Fódlan's Throat. There's a massive fortress there, which is responsible for protecting the eastern border of the Alliance. I like to think of it as a lid on a bottle. The people of Fódlan only know a small part of the world. Their prejudices are born because they don't know what lies beyond their borders. And the opposite is true too. Those outside of Fódlan don't know about this place. Ignorance breeds discrimination. Whether you look inside the bottle or outside of it... If you really look, all you find are people who you can get along with, if you only try. That's why I wanna bust open that lid, which is keeping us locked inside. Or destroy the bottle entirely.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Are you going to tell our allies about this?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I'll find the right time to bring it up. Even if I talked about it now, it doesn't seem realistic, does it? First we need to defeat the Empire and restore peace to... Huh?

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Professor! Claude! We're under attack!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I guess we'll have to cut our conversation short. What's going on, Leonie?

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: It's a small group, but some Imperial troops are headed this way. It looks like they were stationed nearby.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I got to hand it to Edelgard. Nothing gets past that woman.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We should proceed cautiously.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: As long as we don't let our guard down, there's no way they can defeat us.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's take them down.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: All right! I'll show you how much I've improved, Professor!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: This will be our first battle alongside the Knights of Seiros. Let's kick off our new partnership with a magnificent victory!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: The Knights of Seiros are a powerful enemy, but we have more soldiers. We'll take them down all at once!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: So, the enemy intends to use their overwhelming numbers to defeat us. Let's fight fire with... actual fire.

battle.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
battle.line: Report! The enemy has entered the periphery of Garreg Mach!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: If they reach the interior, the enemy will take the monastery. Drive them back immediately!

battle.speaker: Imperial Soldier
battle.line: What? That strange battle flag is... But isn't our enemy the Church of Seiros?

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: They didn't have enough soldiers with just the church, so they upped their numbers by joining with those filthy rogues. It doesn't matter what flag they fly. They're nothing more than a mob. We'll destroy them all!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Allied soldiers are making preparations for the plan. Protect them!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: What? The fire attack unit was routed?! Damn it...my brilliant plan failed.

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: It looks like they were planning something, but it failed!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: We're prepared for the fire attack. Now we just need to draw the enemy's attention. You can't defeat us with that many soldiers? The Imperial army is doomed without a capable general!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: Quiet! Don't think you'll get away with mocking me! Attack! Make sure they never speak again!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: Argh, a fire attack... The damage is too great. We can't fight anymore! All units, retreat! I'll take on our pursuers! Carry away the injured soldiers!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: If we let them escape, they'll come back to attack later. We have to take them out!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: A total loss... But we can't just return home like this...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Teach, look out! They're after your head!

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Phew! Nice work. We won without much incident, thanks to all of you.

end.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
end.line: I don't think the Empire will leave us alone now. What do you plan to do?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I intend to ask the Alliance lords to share some troops with us to bolster our forces.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: I will speak plainly. No matter whom we beseech for reinforcements, our envoys will inevitably pass through Gloucester territory. My father is being cautious not to give the Empire a pretext to intervene. Therefore, he is unlikely to allow even envoys to pass through.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Why not request reinforcements from the Kingdom?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Ah... I guess I haven't told you yet, Teach. The Kingdom isn't in a position to be sending anyone reinforcements. After losing King Lambert during the Tragedy of Duscur, a Regent had been handling it's politics. But then... There was a bloody coup. The Regent and Prince Dimitri both... Apparently the whole family was killed. All Blaiddyd territory, including the Kingdom capital, is being ruled by those who are cooperating with the Empire. The Kingdom is no more. It's not called the Faerghus Dukedom. The vast majority of the former Kingdom lords bent a knee to the overwhelming power of the Empire and the Dukedom, and now fall under their jurisdiction.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Some who formerly held power are continuing to resist, but it would be difficult for them to regain it.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Oh, hey! I can think of one person who we can ask for reinforcements. Someone whose territory is really close, and who's on good terms with Claude...

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Ah! The Hero of Daphnel, I presume?

end.speaker: Leonie
end.line: I've seen her before, and she does seem to be reliable.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: You're talking about Judith, right? I bet she would lend us a hand...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: She seems intimidating.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: She seems strong.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: That's right, you've met her once before, Teach. She's a fearsome one-woman army. She did a lot for me, even before I was recognized as the heir to House Riegan. I don't like the idea of owing her more than I already do, but given the situation, sacrifices must be made. I'll reach out to her. As for the rest of you, prepare for our next battle.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Heya, Teach. How are you feeling? Does anything feel, um... strange at all?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Nothing in particular.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Good. I still vividly remember you suddenly collapsing and passing out after you went through those changes. But maybe that's not a concern now that you've spent five long years napping.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I feel a bit sluggish.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Well, you were asleep for five whole years, after all. It'll probably take time to get you back to top form. Though I'm relieved to see you haven't lost a step as far as combat goes.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Your command bringing my schemes to life... That's just how we fight best.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Any word from Judith?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Not yet, but there's no need to worry. That woman adores me. Once we've bolstered our forces, it'll finally be time to start taking decisive action. But I wonder... Do you really think Rhea is still alive?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: She's alive.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I think so too. It's hard to imagine the death of someone as important as her staying a secret.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I don't know.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: There's no telling. But it's also hard to imagine the death of someone as important as her staying a secret.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I wonder where she is and what she's doing...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Do you hope she's alive?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: All I know is that I still have a lot of questions I need to ask her.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Do you hope she's dead?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: That's a dangerous question, Teach. To be honest, I've given it a lot of thought. All I know is that I still have a lot of questions I need to ask her.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: About the true history of Crest Stones and Heroes' Relics... and the truth behind the legend of Seiros and Nemesis. She has secrets. Too many of them for my comfort. Considering the state of the world... it's suspicious. You must be curious about what was done to you and what her plans were for you, right? And you never did learn about your mother, did you? None of our doubts will ever be clear unless we hear these answers from Rhea herself. In that sense, I absolutely hope Rhea is still alive. But as far as Fódlan goes, I do wonder what a world without Rhea would look like.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: A world without Rhea?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: The majority of people in Fódlan believe in the Seiros faith that Rhea preaches. That's why they accept the noble system as if it were the only option, and refuse to associate with those who believe in anything else. That closed-minded philosophy is the reason why Fódlan's Throat is locked tight. But if you remove the archbishop who strictly advocates that doctrine, that world view is no longer absolute. There's room for free thought. The leadership of the church would undoubtedly fall to you, and you would hold the power to change the shape of the faith. Of the world. Then, for the first time, people would truly be free to think for themselves. To decide what's right, and what's wrong. Honestly, I believe Edelgard is probably hoping to achieve something very similar. But her methods require too much bloodshed. That's not something the world can get behind. Anyway... The best thing we can do is find Rhea and hear what she has to say. Heh, oops... I guess I've been going on for a while now. Sorry about that. You should get some rest.
